form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Thune (for himself, Ms. Cantwell, and Mrs. Murray) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend title XVIII of the Social Security Act to improve the way beneficiaries are assigned under the Medicare shared savings program by also basing such assignment on services furnished by Federally qualified health centers and rural health clinics.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Rural ACO Provider Equity Act of 2015.

section.header: Improvements to the assignment of beneficiaries under the Medicare shared savings program
section.text: Section 1899(c) of the Social Security Act (42 U.S.C. 1395jjj(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking utilization of primary and inserting “utilization of—
in the case of performance years beginning on or after April 1, 2012, primary
in paragraph (1), as added by paragraph (1) of this section, by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

in the case of performance years beginning on or after January 1, 2018, services provided under this title by a Federally qualified health center or rural health clinic (as those terms are defined in section 1861(aa)), as may be determined by the Secretary.
